far_heaa.visualization_toolkit package

Submodules

far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.binary_visualizations module

class far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.binary_visualizations.binaryVizualization(composition: list[str], lattice: Literal['FCC', 'BCC', 'HCP', 'min'], meta_data: dict, save_flag: bool)

Bases: object

A class to visualize the binary phase diagram of a given alloy system. It calculates and plots the miscibility temperatures across a mole fraction grid for a binary composition.

Parameters:

  • composition (list[str]) – A list containing the two elements in the binary alloy.

  • lattice (str) – The lattice type to consider (e.g., ‘FCC’, ‘BCC’).

  • meta_data (dict) – A dictionary containing metadata such as grid size, flags, and file paths.

  • save_flag (bool) – A flag indicating whether the plot should be saved.

Raises:

ValueError – If other than two elements are provided for the composition.

find_misc_temperatures() → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Finds the miscibility temperatures for the binary alloy across a mole fraction grid.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • mol_grid (np.ndarray): The mole fraction grid for the binary alloy.

  • misc_temp (np.ndarray): The miscibility temperatures corresponding to each composition.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

Example

mol_grid, misc_temp = self.find_misc_temperatures()

plot_misc_temperatures() → Tuple[Axes, Figure]

Plots the miscibility temperatures for the binary alloy.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • ax (plt.Axes): The matplotlib axes object for the plot.

  • fig (plt.Figure): The matplotlib figure object for the plot.

Return type:

Tuple[plt.Axes, plt.Figure]

Example

ax, fig = self.plot_misc_temperatures()

far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.heatmap_visualizations module

class far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.heatmap_visualizations.MatrixHeatmap(composition: List[str], add_ele: List[str] | str, lattice: Literal['FCC', 'BCC', 'HCP', 'min'], meta_data: dict, save_flag: bool, path_type: Literal['add', 'transmutate'])

Bases: object

A class to generate heatmaps for the energy hull (E_hull) based on the composition of a given alloy system.

find_indices(main_list, subset)

Finds the indices of the elements in the subset within the main_list.

get_ehull_matrix()

Calculates and returns the mole fraction grid, energy hull values, and temperature grid.

plot_ehull_matrix()

Plots a heatmap of energy hull values against the mole fraction and temperature grids.

static find_indices(main_list: List[str], subset: List[str]) → List[int | None]

Finds the indices of the elements in the subset within the main_list.

Parameters:

  • main_list (List[str]) – The main list of elements.

  • subset (List[str]) – The subset of elements whose indices need to be found.

Returns:

A list of indices corresponding to the elements in the subset.

Returns None if an element from the subset is not found in the main_list.

Return type:

List[Union[int, None]]

get_ehull_matrix() → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray, ndarray]

Calculates and returns the mole fraction grid, energy hull values, and temperature grid.

Returns:

The mole fraction grid, energy hull values, and temperature grid.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

plot_ehull_matrix() → Tuple[Axes, Figure]

Plots a heatmap of energy hull values against the mole fraction and temperature grids.

Returns:

The matplotlib axes and figure objects for the plot.

Return type:

Tuple[plt.Axes, plt.Figure]

far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.miscellaneous_visualizations module

class far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.miscellaneous_visualizations.MiscellaneousVisualizations(meta_data: dict, save_flag: bool)

Bases: object

A class for generating various visualizations related to alloy compositions, including convex hull plots and heatmaps for binary mixing enthalpies.

Parameters:

  • meta_data (dict) – A dictionary containing metadata such as grid size, file paths, and flags.

  • save_flag (bool) – A flag indicating whether to save the visualizations.

grid_iterator

An instance of the GridIterator for iterating through grid data.

Type:

GridIterator

tm

An instance of the ThermoMaths class for thermodynamic calculations.

Type:

ThermoMaths

save_flag

A flag indicating whether to save the generated plots.

Type:

bool

heatmap(element_list: List[str], lattice: Literal['FCC', 'BCC', 'HCP'], sns=None) → Figure

Creates a heatmap of binary mixing enthalpy for a list of elements.

Parameters:

  • element_list (List[str]) – A list of elements for which to create the heatmap.

  • lattice (Literal['FCC', 'BCC', 'HCP']) – The lattice to display (e.g., ‘FCC’, ‘BCC’).

  • sns (optional) – Seaborn instance for customized plotting.

Returns:

The matplotlib figure object for the heatmap.

Return type:

plt.Figure

Example

heatmap = self.heatmap(element_list=[‘Fe’, ‘Ni’, ‘Al’], genre=’unbiased’)

plot_convex_hull(composition: List[str], temperature: float) → Tuple[Axes, Figure]

Plots the convex hull for a given alloy composition at a specified temperature.

Parameters:

  • composition (List[str]) – A list of elements in the alloy composition.

  • temperature (float) – The temperature in Kelvin.

Returns:

A tuple containing the matplotlib axes and figure objects for the plot.

Return type:

Tuple[plt.Axes, plt.Figure]

Example

ax, fig = self.plot_convex_hull(composition=[‘Fe’, ‘Ni’], temperature=1200)

far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.pathway_visualizations module

class far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.pathway_visualizations.PathwayVisualizations(composition: List[str], lattice: Literal['FCC', 'BCC', 'HCP', 'min'], meta_data: dict, save_flag: bool)

Bases: object

A class for visualizing reaction pathways for a given alloy composition and lattice structure.

Parameters:

  • composition (list) – A list of elements in the alloy system.

  • lattice (str) – The lattice structure to consider (e.g., ‘FCC’, ‘BCC’).

  • meta_data (dict) – A dictionary containing metadata such as grid size, file paths, and flags.

  • save_flag (bool) – A flag indicating whether to save the visualizations.

static find_indices_in_range(float_list: ndarray, threshold: float = 200) → List[List[int]]

Finds groups of indices in the input list where values are within the specified threshold.

Parameters:

  • float_list (np.ndarray) – A list of float values to compare.

  • threshold (float, optional) – The maximum difference between values to group them. Default is 200.

Returns:

A list of lists where each inner list contains indices of grouped values.

Return type:

List[List[int]]

static get_n_colors_from_cmap(cmap_name: str, N: int) → List[tuple]

Generates N evenly spaced colors from a given colormap.

Parameters:

  • cmap_name (str) – The name of the colormap to use.

  • N (int) – The number of colors to generate.

Returns:

A list of RGB tuples representing the colors.

Return type:

List[tuple]

get_rP() → Dict[str, List[ndarray]]

Calculates reaction pathways for the alloy system and returns miscibility temperatures for each pathway.

Returns:

A dictionary where the keys are reaction pathways (e.g., ‘Fe-Ni’) and the values are lists of miscibility temperatures along each pathway.

Return type:

dict

Example

path_dict = self.get_rP()

plot_rP() → Tuple[Axes, Figure]

Plots the reaction pathways for the alloy system and the corresponding miscibility temperatures.

Returns:

A tuple containing the matplotlib axes and figure objects for the plot.

Return type:

Tuple[plt.Axes, plt.Figure]

Example

ax, fig = self.plot_rP()

text_segregators(texts: ndarray) → dict[str, list[float]]

Groups text labels by their proximity and returns their adjusted positions for plotting.

Parameters:

texts (np.ndarray) – An array of text labels and their positions.

Returns:

A dictionary where the keys are concatenated text labels and the values are their adjusted positions.

Return type:

dict

Draws a circle with the given radius on a polar plot.

Parameters:

  • radius (float) – The radius of the circle.

  • ax (plt.Axes) – The polar plot axes on which the circle is drawn.

static get_n_colors_from_cmap(cmap_name: str, N: int) → List

Retrieves N equally spaced colors from the specified colormap.

make_one_bar(ax: Axes, n_alloy: int, member_pos: List[int], i: str, N: int, angle: float, idx2: int) → float

Plots a single bar representing miscibility temperature on a polar plot.

Parameters:

  • ax (plt.Axes) – The polar plot axes.

  • n_alloy (int) – The number of elements in the alloy.

  • member_pos (List[int]) – The position of the elements in the composition.

  • i (str) – The alloy composition string.

  • N (int) – The dimensionality of the alloy.

  • angle (float) – The angle in degrees for the bar placement.

  • idx2 (int) – Index for coloring the bar.

Returns:

The first miscibility temperature value for this bar.

Return type:

float

misc_temp(member_pos: List[int], x: ndarray, N: int, flag: Literal['add', 'transmutate']) → ndarray

Retrieves miscibility temperature data for the specified composition and lattice.

Parameters:

  • member_pos (List[int]) – Indices of the members in the composition.

  • x (np.ndarray) – The mole fraction grid.

  • N (int) – The dimensionality of the composition.

  • flag (Literal['add', 'transmutate']) – A flag to determine whether to “add” or “transmute” elements.

Returns:

Miscibility temperatures for the given composition.

Return type:

np.ndarray

plot_colored_secant(ax: Axes, radius: float, angle_start: float, angle_end: float, misc_temp_list_sec: ndarray, cmap, norm, zorder: int = 50) → None

Plots a colored secant line between two angles on a polar plot.

Parameters:

  • ax (plt.Axes) – The polar plot axes.

  • radius (float) – The radius for the secant line.

  • angle_start (float) – The starting angle in radians.

  • angle_end (float) – The ending angle in radians.

  • misc_temp_list_sec (np.ndarray) – The miscibility temperature values for each segment of the secant.

  • cmap – Colormap for coloring the secant.

  • norm – Normalization for the colormap.

  • zorder (int, optional) – The drawing order. Defaults to 50.

plot_line(angle_degrees: float, x_values: ndarray, temp_list: ndarray, ax: Axes, cmap, norm, zorder: int) → None

Plots a line with varying color on a polar plot based on temperature values.

Parameters:

  • angle_degrees (float) – The angle in degrees where the line should be drawn.

  • x_values (np.ndarray) – The x-values corresponding to mole fractions.

  • temp_list (np.ndarray) – List of temperature values for coloring the line.

  • ax (plt.Axes) – The polar plot axes.

  • cmap – Colormap to use for coloring the line.

  • norm – Normalization for the colormap.

  • zorder (int) – The drawing order.

plot_subset(N_ind: int, transmute_indices: List[int]) → Tuple[Axes, Figure]

Plots polar diagrams for a specific N-index with optional transmutation lines.

Parameters:

  • N_ind (int) – The N-index to plot.

  • transmute_indices (List[int]) – The indices of elements to transmute.

Returns:

The matplotlib axes and figure objects for the plot.

Return type:

Tuple[plt.Axes, plt.Figure]

Generates a full polar plot for all compositions in the alloy system.

Returns:

The matplotlib axes and figure objects for the plot.

Return type:

Tuple[plt.Axes, plt.Figure]

far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.ternary_visualizations module

class far_heaa.visualization_toolkit.ternary_visualizations.TernaryVizualization(composition: list[str], lattice: Literal['FCC', 'BCC', 'HCP', 'min'], meta_data: dict, save_flag: bool, contour_flag: bool)

Bases: object

A class for visualizing ternary phase diagrams and miscibility temperatures for a given alloy composition.

Parameters:

  • composition (list[str]) – A list of three elements in the ternary alloy system.

  • lattice (str) – The lattice structure (e.g., ‘FCC’, ‘BCC’).

  • meta_data (dict) – A dictionary containing metadata such as grid size, file paths, and flags.

  • save_flag (bool) – A flag indicating whether to save the visualizations.

  • contour_flag (bool) – A flag indicating whether to use contour plots or scatter plots.

cmap

The colormap to use for plotting.

Type:

str

norm

Normalization for color mapping.

Type:

Normalize

tm

An instance of the ThermoMaths class for thermodynamic calculations.

Type:

ThermoMaths

grid_iterator

An instance of the GridIterator class for grid-based iteration.

Type:

GridIterator

save_flag

A flag indicating whether to save the generated plots.

Type:

bool

contour_flag

A flag indicating whether to generate contour plots.

Type:

bool

find_isotherm(temperature: float) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Finds the isotherm (temperature slice) of the energy above the convex hull for the ternary alloy.

Parameters:

temperature (float) – The temperature in Kelvin to evaluate the isotherm.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • mol_grid (np.ndarray): The mole fraction grid for the ternary alloy.

  • stables (np.ndarray): The stability of the alloy compositions at the given temperature.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

find_misc_temperatures() → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]

Finds miscibility temperatures for the ternary alloy across a mole fraction grid.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • mol_grid (np.ndarray): The mole fraction grid for the ternary alloy.

  • misc_temp (np.ndarray): The miscibility temperatures corresponding to each composition.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

plot_isotherm(temperature: float) → Tuple[Axes, Figure]

Plots the isotherm (temperature slice) of the energy above the convex hull for the ternary alloy.

Parameters:

temperature (float) – The temperature in Kelvin to evaluate the isotherm.

Returns:

A tuple containing the matplotlib axes and figure objects for the plot.

Return type:

Tuple[plt.Axes, plt.Figure]

plot_misc_temperatures() → Tuple[Axes, Figure]

Plots the miscibility temperatures for the ternary alloy.

Returns:

A tuple containing the matplotlib axes and figure objects for the plot.

Return type:

Tuple[plt.Axes, plt.Figure]

plot_ternary_visualizations(T_min: float, T_max: float, T_gradation: float, switch_contour_off: bool = False, switch_scatter_off: bool = False) → None

Generates and saves ternary visualizations, including miscibility temperature plots and isotherms for a given temperature range and gradation. (both contours and scatters

Parameters:

  • T_min (float) – The minimum temperature for the isotherm grid.

  • T_max (float) – The maximum temperature for the isotherm grid.

  • T_gradation (float) – The temperature step/gradation between isotherms.

  • switch_contour_off (bool) – Whether to switch the contour off. Default is False.

  • switch_scatter_off (bool) – Whether to switch the scatter off. Default is False.

RaisesError: If switch_contour_off and switch_scatter_off is True.

Example

self.plot_ternary_visualizations(T_min=300, T_max=1500, T_gradation=100)
